water something ↔ down.translation[0].de: to make a statement, report etc less forceful by changing it or removing parts that may offend people – used to show disapproval
The report of the investigation had been watered down.
to add water to a drink to make it less strong
water something ↔ down.translation[1].de: to make a suggestion, rule, or proposal less forceful by removing some parts of it
A late amendment watered down the insider-trading penalties to a £100,000 maximum fine instead of the earlier £500,000.
